alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Screven; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 9:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, SCREVEN, EVANS, BULLOCH, CANDLER, EFFINGHAM, TATTNALL, BEAUFORT, HAMPTON, COLLETON, DORCHESTER AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 951 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Lodge to near Captolo to Cobbtown, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Statesboro, Walterboro, Reidsville, Ridgeland, Springfield, Claxton, Pembroke, and Saint George. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: A severe thunderstorm watch is in effect. Thunderstorms can produce large hail, damaging winds and isolated tornadoes suddenly, sometimes with little or no warning. Be alert for rapidly changing weather conditions and be ready to act quickly if severe weather is observed or a warning is issued. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Screven; Tattnall
